title: Two Negative and Two Positive Charges

Four point charges, A, B, C, and D, are located at the centers of the sides of a square, as shown above. The charges have the values indicated in the figure. Each charge is held in place by an external force. Point P is at the center of the square.

(a) The magnitude of the electric field at point P due to charge A is <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Describe the magnitude and direction of the net electric field resulting from all four charges at point P in terms of <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and the coordinate axes shown. Briefly explain your reasoning.

(b) The magnitude of the forces required to hold charges A and C in place are <math alttext="F subscript A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="F subscript C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> respectively. Is <math alttext="F subscript A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> greater than, less than, or equal to <math alttext="F subscript C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Briefly justify your answer.

The configuration of charges was assembled by placing individual charges one at a time onto the square. The configuration is shown again below. The graph below shows the electric potential <math alttext="V subscript P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> at point P as the charges were placed onto the square.

(c) In a clear, coherent paragraph-length response, describe the order in which the charges were assembled into their final configuration. Justify your claims by citing relevant physics principles and features of the graph.
